result.execSummary:
The defendant Randal M. Herrick Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 11:00am [mo]
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance 

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Laitsch
--submits exhibit #1 (letter from Mr. Herrick's employer)
Statement made by Mr. Herrick 

On Count #1:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, to be consecutive to any other sentence in being ; to commence forthwith
--pay costs of $243 (no DNA surcharge ordered in Count #1)  

On Count #3: 
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, to be consecutive to any other sentence in being ; to commence forthwith
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay officer overtime costs of $121.07

The Court has determined that Mr. Herrick has already given a biological sample, and does not need to give another sample for this case. 
All costs and fees are to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 5/11/15 and on the 11th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 18 days in the Jefferson Co. Jail, consecutive to any other sentence in being, with Huber privileges.  

The Court gives 2 days of sentence credit to Count #1.

The Court allows the State to submit a Motion to Alter the DNA surcharge as to Count #1 at a later date, 
recess: 11:51am

[Post hearing/ off-record: In response to the Clerk's inquiry, the Court indicates that it mis-spoke when it designated that the sentences that to commence forthwith; these sentences are each consecutive to any sentence in being. MK/MO]
Petition for payment of attorney fees w/cover letter
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
criminal case settlement
with attached jury instructions
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 11:02am [mo]
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock informs the Court that parties have reached an agreement, Attorney Laitsch agrees.
Atty. Laitsch requests to enter a plea today and sentencing at a later date. 
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered on counts #1 & #3; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts of this case. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess:11:15am  

NEXT: Sentencing Hearing: April 10,2015 at 11:00am

case called at 1:30pm. [MK]
Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court staff has learned that Mr. Herrick was sent out to work today on Huber Release; the Huber-section deputy did not know whether Mr. Herrick intended to leave work to come to this hearing. 
Attorney Laitsch indicates that did not know that Mr. Herrick was to appear today; he has not made contact with Mr. Herrick to ensure this occurred.
The Court excuses Mr. Herrick's non-appearance at this hearing. 

On Defendant's 2/26/15 Trial Motions: 
--as to paragraph two, the Motion for Witness Sequestration [Exclusion] is granted, along with the State's request to have Officer K. Miller excepted from the Order as the State's Court Officer. 
--as to paragraph six, the Court clarifies that it will ask each attorney to name their witnesses during jury selection, and will then give cautionary language on the listing of witenesses.
--as to pargraph ten:  in response to the inquiry raised by DA Happ, Attorney Laitsch confirms that the State has provided the Defense with the Notice of Intent to Admit Statements, and that Defense is not raising any type of Miranda-Goodchild challenge through the filing of this Motion
--the Court grants the remaining portions of the Motions without objection or argument

On Defendant's 2/26/15 Motion in Limine: 
--DA Happ confirms that there is no intention to admit Other Acts Evidence
--the Court grants the Motions in Limine, with the understanding that the motion in paragraph three does not include the elements of the crime 
--as to the remaining paragraphs, the Court grants the requests without objection or argument 

On State's 2/19/15 Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions:
--after hearing the arguments of counsel, the Court concludes that Mr. Herrick has nine prior convictions for Statute 906.09 purposes. 

On State's 2/19/15 Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant:
--Attorney Laitsch acknowledges receipt of the statements with highlighting added to specify which statements the State intends to present at trial
--Attorney Laitsch cites Statute 908.045(4) and Statutes 908.01(4)(b)(1) in opposition to the admission of statements, however the Court finds that there is a proper statutory basis for admission, and the Court allows admission of the statements through a proper witness.

Counsel indicate that there are no concerns related to discovery. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court will allow juror notetaking and the Court will allow the jurors to ask questions of witnesses under Wis JI Criminal 57. 
The Court informs counsel of its intent to avoid sidebar conferences on evidentiary matters or legal objections, though sidebars on juror questions or on scheduling issues is permissible. 
The Court informs counsel that it intends to give the burden of proof, presumption of innocence, and substantive jury instructions during the jury selection process. 
Counsel indicate they are not anticipating any request for individual voir dire, or for the Court to ask questions other than those set forth in Special Materials. 
The Court informs counsel of its typical trial day schedule. 
The Court declines to carry an additional juror; the Jury will consist of twelve people. 
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance. 
recess 2:25pm. 


NEXT:  the 4/6/15 FSSC and the 4/9/15 Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar

Case called at 1:18 pm
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD appears for bond purposes only). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews previous conflict review worksheet, continues to find no other reason to recuse or disqualify itself.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; felony charges and maximum penalties recited; reading of misdemeanor charges and maximum penalties waived.
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Counts #1 - #7.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court appoints Attorney Laitsch to represent the defendant on this case.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Virginia Bowes or Randal Herrick Sr.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:28 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: to be set
PTC: 11/26/14 at 11:00 am
